Answer: Because the three lower proximate stages have a different feeling from the fundamental stage,
when seeking to attain the fundamental stage,
there are those who are able to enter it,
and there are those who are unable to enter it.
Because the feelings of the five upper proximate stages are no different from the fundamental stage,
when seeking to attain the fundamental stage, one definitely is able to enter it.

they must give rise to joy and delight in their own fundamental stage,
because if the mind is able to give rise to it, it must definitely give rise to it.
